gov.nist.csd.pm.common.model.graph

Interface Graph

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    GraphPAP, GraphService, MemGraph, Neo4jGraph, SQLGraph

    public interface Graph
    Interface for maintaining an NGAC graph.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • createNode

        long createNode(NodeContext node)
         throws PMException
        Create a new node with the given name, type and properties and add it to the graph.
        Parameters:
        node - The context of the node to create. This includes the id, name, type, and properties.
        Returns:
        The ID of the newly created node.
        Throws:
        PMException

      • updateNode

        void updateNode(NodeContext node)
         throws PMException
        Update the name and properties of the node with the given ID. The node's existing properties will be overwritten by the ones provided. The name parameter is optional and will be ignored if null or empty. The properties parameter will be ignored only if null. If the map is empty, the node's properties will be overwritten with the empty map.
        Parameters:
        node - The node to update. This includes the id, name, and properties.
        Throws:
        PMException

      • deleteNode

        void deleteNode(long nodeID)
         throws PMException
        Delete the node with the given ID from the graph.
        Parameters:
        nodeID - the ID of the node to delete.
        Throws:
        PMException

      • exists

        boolean exists(long nodeID)
        throws PMException
        Check that a node with the given ID exists in the graph.
        Parameters:
        nodeID - the ID of the node to check for.
        Returns:
        True or False if a node with the given ID exists or not.
        Throws:
        PMException

      • getNodes

        java.util.HashSet<NodeContext> getNodes()
                                 throws PMException
        Retrieve the set of all nodes in the graph.
        Returns:
        A Set of all the nodes in the graph.
        Throws:
        PMException

      • getPolicies

        java.util.HashSet<java.lang.Long> getPolicies()
                                       throws PMException
        Get the set of policy classes. This operation is run every time a decision is made, so a separate method is needed to improve efficiency. The returned set is just the IDs of each policy class.
        Returns:
        The set of policy class IDs.
        Throws:
        PMException

      • getChildren

        java.util.HashSet<NodeContext> getChildren(long nodeID)
                                    throws PMException
        Get the set of nodes that are assigned to the node with the given ID.
        Parameters:
        nodeID - The ID of the node to get the children of.
        Returns:
        The Set of NGACNodes that are assigned to the node with the given ID.
        Throws:
        PMException

      • getParents

        java.util.HashSet<NodeContext> getParents(long nodeID)
                                   throws PMException
        Get the set of nodes that the node with the given ID is assigned to.
        Parameters:
        nodeID - The ID of the node to get the parents of.
        Returns:
        The Set of NGACNodes that are assigned to the node with the given ID.
        Throws:
        PMException

      • assign

        void assign(NodeContext childCtx,
            NodeContext parentCtx)
     throws PMException
        Assign the child node to the parent node. The child and parent nodes must both already exist in the graph, and the types must make a valid assignment. An example of a valid assignment is assigning o1, an object, to oa1, an object attribute. o1 is the child (objects can never be the parent in an assignment), and oa1 is the parent.
        Parameters:
        childCtx - The context information for the child in the assignment. The ID and type are required.
        parentCtx - The context information for the parent in the assignment The ID and type are required.
        Throws:
        PMException

      • deassign

        void deassign(NodeContext childCtx,
              NodeContext parentCtx)
       throws PMException
        Remove the Assignment between the child and parent nodes.
        Parameters:
        childCtx - The context information for the child of the assignment.
        parentCtx - The context information for the parent of the assignment.
        Throws:
        PMException

      • associate

        void associate(NodeContext uaCtx,
               NodeContext targetCtx,
               java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String> operations)
        throws PMException
        Create an Association between the User Attribute and the Target node with the provided operations. If an association already exists between these two nodes, overwrite the existing operations with the ones provided. Associations can only begin at a User Attribute but can point to either an Object or User Attribute
        Parameters:
        uaCtx - The information for the User Attribute in the association.
        targetCtx - The context information for the target of the association.
        operations - A Set of operations to add to the association.
        Throws:
        PMException

      • dissociate

        void dissociate(NodeContext uaCtx,
                NodeContext targetCtx)
         throws PMException
        Delete the Association between the User Attribute and Target node.
        Parameters:
        targetCtx - The context information for the target of the association.
        targetCtx - The context information for the target of the association.
        Throws:
        PMException

      • getSourceAssociations

        java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Long,java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String>> getSourceAssociations(long sourceID)
                                                                                     throws PMException
        Retrieve the associations the given node is the source of. The source node of an association is always a User Attribute and this method will throw an exception if an invalid node is provided. The returned Map will contain the target and operations of each association.
        Parameters:
        sourceID - The ID of the source node.
        Returns:
        A Map of the target node IDs and the operations for each association.
        Throws:
        PMException

      • getTargetAssociations

        java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Long,java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String>> getTargetAssociations(long targetID)
                                                                                     throws PMException
        Retrieve the associations the given node is the target of. The target node can be an Object Attribute or a User Attribute. This method will throw an exception if a node of any other type is provided. The returned Map will contain the source node IDs and the operations of each association.
        Parameters:
        targetID - the ID of the target node.
        Returns:
        A Map of the source Ids and the operations for each association.
        Throws:
        PMException
